intro: Keraselma peplus, commonly known as the lesser pigmy weed, is a small flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or arid regions. Its leaves are succulent and fleshy, adapted to store water, while its flowers are usually pale green or yellowish. Keraselma peplus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
